tachyon.client.file

Class BaseFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.client.file.BaseFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LineageFileSystem

    @ThreadSafe
 @PublicApi
public class BaseFileSystem
extends Object
implements FileSystem
    Default implementation of the FileSystem interface. Developers can extend this class instead of implementing the interface. This implementation reads and writes data through FileInStream and FileOutStream. This class is thread safe.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface tachyon.client.file.FileSystem

        FileSystem.Factory

                            InvalidPathException,
                            IOException,
                            TachyonException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Convenience method for FileSystem.createDirectory(TachyonURI, CreateDirectoryOptions) with default options.
        Specified by:
        createDirectory in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the directory to create in Tachyon space
        Throws:
        FileAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a file or directory at the given path
        InvalidPathException - if the path is invalid
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if an unexpected exception is thrown

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • mount

        public void mount(TachyonURI src,
                  TachyonURI dst,
                  MountOptions options)
           throws IOException,
                  TachyonException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Mounts a UFS subtree to the given Tachyon path. The Tachyon path is expected not to exist as the method creates it. If the path already exists, a TachyonException will be thrown. This method does not transfer any data or metadata from the UFS. It simply establishes the connection between the given Tachyon path and UFS path.
        Specified by:
        mount in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        src - a Tachyon path to mount the data to
        dst - a UFS path to mount the data from
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs

      • rename

        public void rename(TachyonURI src,
                   TachyonURI dst,
                   RenameOptions options)
            throws FileDoesNotExistException,
                   IOException,
                   TachyonException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Renames an existing Tachyon path to another Tachyon path in Tachyon. This operation will be propagated in the underlying storage if the path is persisted.
        Specified by:
        rename in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        src - the path of the source, this must already exist
        dst - the path of the destination, this path should not exist
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given file does not exist
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

             throws IOException,
                    TachyonException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Convenience method for FileSystem.unmount(TachyonURI, UnmountOptions) with default options.
        Specified by:
        unmount in interface FileSystem

      • unmount

        public void unmount(TachyonURI path,
                    UnmountOptions options)
             throws IOException,
                    TachyonException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Unmounts a UFS subtree identified by the given Tachyon path. The Tachyon path match a previously mounted path. The contents of the subtree rooted at this path are removed from Tachyon but the corresponding UFS subtree is left untouched.
        Specified by:
        unmount in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - a Tachyon path, this must be a mount point
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs
